intro: Neocouma duckei, commonly known as the Ducke's neocouma, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of tropical forests. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a conservation concern in its native range.
